com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface createOrderFromQuote

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface createOrderFromQuote

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createOrderFromQuote(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The createOrderFromQuote API creates an order from a Quote.

    • Method Detail

      • createOrderFromQuote

        org.w3c.dom.Document createOrderFromQuote(YFSEnvironment env,
                                          org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                   throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                          java.rmi.RemoteException

        The createOrderFromQuote API creates an order from a Quote. The configurable template, Default Order From Quote, will be used to determine what attributes from the Quote to copy to the newly created order. The associated opportunity record will be moved to Won status. The alternative quotes for the opportunity will be moved to abandoned status. All recommended lines will be ignored when creating the order. The quote will be moved to ordered status. All recommended lines on the quote will be moved to abandoned * status. DefaultCustomerInformation attribute for order is defaulted to Y. The quote is always in draft status (i.e. DraftOrderFlag=Y) for the complete quote process flow cycle. Hence Bill-to-Address is not mandatory for a quote. If Bill-To-Address is not set for a quote, the createOrderFromQuote API fails, when DraftOrderFlag is passed as N in the input xml. In such a case, either set Bill-To-Address for the quote or execute createOrderFromQuote API with DraftOrderFlag=Y.

        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: See createOrder API for details.

        Events Raised: See createOrder API for additional events.

        Raised during the transaction CREATE_ORD_FROM_QUOTE
        ON_SUCCESS:
        This event is raised upon successful execution of createOrderFromQuote. The output contains the details of the order created.
        Data published - CREATE_ORD_FROM_QUOTE.ON_SUCCESS
        Template Support: Yes

        Audits: Configurable

        Pre-conditions:

        • Order must exist.

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Additional Information:

        This API will create an order with the document type configured by the CREATE_ORD_FROM_QUOTE transaction's derived document type. Attributes configured in the Default From Quote template will be used to create the order.

        All the validations and defaulting rules performed by the createOrder API are applicable to the createOrderFromQuote API. See createOrder for more details.

        NOTE: If the createOrderFromQuote API is used within a monitor event service, please ensure that it used in a different transaction boundary than the order monitor itself. Using the same transaction boundary may prevent future iterations.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the output of the created order. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
